Title: DH lost laptop and now assignment will be late
Message:
Yay! Glad you found the laptop!

Perhaps have a rule that he's not allowed to borrow your laptop at all. Sounds harsh but if it's that vital for your course maybe it needs to be off limits so this doesn't happen again. There's no way he can guarantee that he won't place it somewhere random again (without thinking) at a vital moment for you so you have this stress again.  

I have ADHD btw. I wouldn't want responsibility for something so important to someone else. He should have his own laptop that he can then leave where he wants. 

One further thought - I found this book amazing for ADHD friendly organisation tips. The best book I've read and has really helped me at home:

[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/1592335128/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_awdb_imm_t1_V0JPA9QCXBY9WEBT917H https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/1592335128/ref=cm]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/1592335128/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_awdb_imm_t1_V0JPA9QCXBY9WEBT917H sw]]w_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/1592335128/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_awdb_imm_t1_V0JPA9QCXBY9WEBT917H r]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/1592335128/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_awdb_imm_t1_V0JPA9QCXBY9WEBT917H cp]]p_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/1592335128/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_awdb_imm_t1_V0JPA9QCXBY9WEBT917H awdb]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/1592335128/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_awdb_imm_t1_V0JPA9QCXBY9WEBT917H imm]]m_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/1592335128/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_awdb_imm_t1_V0JPA9QCXBY9WEBT917H t1_V0JPA9QCXBY9WEBT917H]]

And he really has to stop the major organisation all at once. I have done this soooo many times and have realised I have to do small bits at a time. Otherwise I end up with EVERYTHING out everywhere and then lose all momentum and get really overwhelmed and don't know what to do with anything.  And then it sits there for weeks and weeks. No massive sort outs needs to be the rule. 

And if you need to do one, do a planned one together. I find it much easier to sort the garage for example if my husband is able to help keep me on track and focussed on the task and not get sidetracked and also he helps when I get stuck and don't know what to do with something. Which can lead to buffering. 

Anyway waffling again. So will go now. Hope some of that helps!
Cleaned_Message: glad found perhaps rule borrow harsh vital course maybe needs happen way guarantee place somewhere random without thinking vital moment stress want responsibility something important someone else leave one thought found book amazing friendly best book read really home ref ref ref ref ref ref ref ref really stop major done many times small time otherwise end everything everywhere lose momentum get really know anything massive sort needs rule need one one together find much easier sort garage example husband able help keep track task get also get stuck know something lead anyway hope

Title: What training is needed?
Message:
I would consider whistle training, but if your MIL is going to refuse to keep them on at least a longline during training, itâ€™s going to be difficult, as they will continue to reinforce the behaviour you donâ€™t want, which will undermine training.  Also a lot of the groundwork is done at home, so youâ€™d need MIL to put the time and effort in while you arenâ€™t around as well as on walks.

If you do want to give it a go I would recommend [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Total-Recall-Perfect-Response-Training/dp/1846891493/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&crid=1K46UY61CBOWH&keywords=total+recall+pippa+mattinson&sprefix=Total+recal%2Caps%2C169&tag=mumsnetforu03-21&qid=1611308081&sr=8-1 Total Recall by Pippa Mattinson]].  

In addition to whistle training, ideally, you need to teach them that staying with you and you MIL is far more fun and rewarding than running after every person/dog they see on the horizon.  What do they love most, food/toys/attention?  Use whichever it is or a mix of them to get them focussed on you and ignore the distraction.  Again though, lots of groundwork to be done at home before they would be reliable enough to allow off on walks and if MIL is unwilling to have them on a lead/longline itâ€™s going to be difficult.
Cleaned_Message: would consider whistle training mil going refuse keep least training going difficult continue reinforce behaviour want undermine training also lot groundwork done home need mil put time effort around well want give would recommend total recall perfect response training ref total recall total tag total recall addition whistle training ideally need teach mil far fun rewarding running every person dog see horizon love food attention use whichever mix get ignore distraction though lots groundwork done home would reliable enough allow mil unwilling lead going difficult

Title: Newborn not napping well in the day
Message:
have you tried one of these? DS is the same with his arms up but also wakes himself up with them. He sleeps really well in this (for a newborn!) 
https://www.amazon.co.uk/Love-dream-Swaddle-White-3-6kgs/dp/B005MAURNS/ref=mpsa13?dchild=1&keywords=love+to+dream+swaddle&qid=1610811163&sprefix=love+&sr=8-3

 glad things are a ^little^ better! Hopefully that continues. 

DS actually had a good night until 4:30, I've been up since then but he slept for three hours on me this morning and then another hour. Have swapped with DP now. 

Unfortunately the anti reflux formula is too thick to fit through the SNS tubes as we found out with a very upset DS in the night. So back to normal formula for now, if it gets worse it'll have to be anti reflux formula and bottles so goodbye to the SNS which is really upsetting. We shall see.
Cleaned_Message: tried one arms also wakes really well love dream swaddle white ref love dream swaddle love glad little better hopefully actually good night since slept three morning another hour unfortunately anti reflux formula thick fit found upset night back normal formula worse anti reflux formula really upsetting shall see

Title: What to do when very overweight, zero will power and very unhappy?!
Message: I recommend listening to the Dr Chatterjee podcast Feel Better Live More and his book [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Feel-Great-Lose-Weight-sustainable/dp/0241397839?tag=mumsnetforu03-21]] itâ€™s really helped me feel better about losing weight and figure out where to start. For me the key is to be living the lifestyle I want, now. Not always thinking, my life will be better when Iâ€™ve lost the 4 stone I need to. So the exercise, sleep, food I eat etc is for me to feel healthy and alive, not just to lose weight. Iâ€™m not sure if that makes sense? This book has helped me as Dr C is very kind and insightful about the reasons we get overweight and how to reorganise our lives. Good luck.
Cleaned_Message: recommend listening feel better live book feel great lose weight sustainable tag really feel better losing weight figure start key living want always thinking life better lost stone need exercise sleep food eat feel healthy alive lose weight sure sense book kind insightful get overweight good luck

Title: Sneaking electronics and lying
Message:
I read a book 5 or 6 years back about the impact of devices on social skills and what you describe is textbook [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Growing-Up-Social-Relational-Screen-Driven/dp/0802411231?tag=mumsnetforu03-21]]  and it did give strategies about reestablishing some normality . 
Mind you, the situation in 2021 is far worse that it was in 2015, but I find it interesting (minus the God talk present from time to time) 

 it is more babies watching YouTube but I do wonder sometimes with mothers on their phones in parks, beaches, or walking and not looking at their children or interacting with them. Even if the child is facing forward, you can talk with them, they can feel your interest  [[https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2018/07/the-dangers-of-distracted-parenting/561752/]]
Cleaned_Message: read book back impact social describe textbook growing social relational screen driven tag give normality mind situation far worse find interesting minus god talk present time time watching wonder sometimes walking looking even child facing forward talk feel interest magazine archive distracted

Title: Little things for the house that make life easier - Iâ€™m doing a shop
Message:
*Graphista* rep the veg bags - I buy veg from out local market so it comes loose. I use the veg bags that now almost all supermarkets have for safe for a few pennies each. They are kind of mesh bag which slow for air circulation and can be washed. My veg seems to last longer in those than plastic bags.
I also bought this for lettuce/ salad - bit pricey but definable lasts longer without getting sweaty/ slimy and you can get different sizes. 

https://www.amazon.co.uk/Produce-ProKeeper-2-8L-Fresher-Longer/dp/B073TZJMV4

If using bagged salad, you can use the tip of putting a piece of very slightly damp kitchen roll in the bag which keeps it fresher for longer
Cleaned_Message: rep buy local market comes loose use almost safe kind mesh bag slow air circulation washed last longer plastic also bought lettuce salad bit definable longer without getting sweaty slimy get different sizes produce longer bagged salad use tip piece slightly damp kitchen roll bag longer

Title: Little things for the house that make life easier - Iâ€™m doing a shop
Message:
I thought I was pretty good at this sort of organisation and gadget stuff - I already had silicon lids, packing cubes, extra long changing cables, really useful wrapping paper boxes, the shoe hangers in the bathroom for cleaning products, beeswax wrappers... 

I'm now the proud owner of an ultra tidy cutlery drawer (Joseph Joseph), the lodge pan scrapers, proper sectioned storage for the Christmas tree baubles and (my favourite of all) a usb candle lighter. 

In the hope that there's still someone looking for something to improve their kitchen collection, I'd also like to share these silicon sandwich/freezer bags which are fantastic:

OCOOPA Reusable Food Storage Bags - Extra Thick Leakproof Degradable Freezer Bag - FDA Grade PEVA Sandwich & Snack Bags- Plastic Free Ziplock Lunch Bag for Kids Snacks,Fruit,Travel,Home Organization [[https://smile.amazon.co.uk/dp/B07TM487QG/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_xr4.Fb2NTPM17 https://smile.amazon.co.uk/dp/B07TM487QG/ref=cm]][[https://smile.amazon.co.uk/dp/B07TM487QG/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_xr4.Fb2NTPM17 sw]]w_[[https://smile.amazon.co.uk/dp/B07TM487QG/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_xr4.Fb2NTPM17 r]][[https://smile.amazon.co.uk/dp/B07TM487QG/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_xr4.Fb2NTPM17 cp]]p_[[https://smile.amazon.co.uk/dp/B07TM487QG/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_xr4.Fb2NTPM17 api]][[https://smile.amazon.co.uk/dp/B07TM487QG/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_xr4.Fb2NTPM17 fabc]]c_[[https://smile.amazon.co.uk/dp/B07TM487QG/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_xr4.Fb2NTPM17 xr4.Fb2NTPM17]]

Title: 5 month old LOVES food
Message:
Based on your reply, there are two books I would like to recommend. 
The first one is a cookbook called On the side, by Ed Smith. It is by far, the book that suggest diet fort the widest variety of vegetable . Plenty of recipes with lentils and chickpeas as well. Just remember that you can not add salt until you have removed the baby's plate. 
The other is not a cookbook but a reflection on how we eat and how we discover it form early age. It is called First bites by Bee Wilson. [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/First-Bite-How-Learn-Eat/dp/0465064981?tag=mumsnetforu03-21]]

When starting with fruit, you can make apple sauce but simmering piece of apples in minimal water. Pear sauce is equally delicious, and pear will develop a sort of vanilla taste when cooked. Banana is easier poached if baby hasn't developed mastication (boiling water, cut pieces of banana, cook for 2 min, remove banana without  adding any water, blend or crush) 
If you can, don't used canned fruit. A canned apricot tastes nothing like a real one. 
My strongest recommendation remains to avoid the baby snack food aisle and the baby crips, baby puffs, baby bars. Processed food are addictive, nutrition void  and don't taste like and altered tastebuds is recognised as a consequence of processed food [[https://life.spectator.co.uk/articles/processed-food-is-having-a-sinister-effect-on-our-taste-buds/]]
Cleaned_Message: based reply two would like recommend first one cookbook side smith far book suggest diet fort variety vegetable plenty well remember add salt removed baby plate cookbook reflection eat discover form early age first bee first bite learn eat tag starting fruit make apple sauce piece minimal water pear sauce equally delicious pear develop sort vanilla taste banana easier baby mastication boiling water cut banana cook min remove banana without water blend crush used canned fruit canned apricot nothing like real one recommendation remains avoid baby snack food aisle baby baby baby food nutrition void taste like consequence food life spectator food sinister effect taste

Title: 50 Book Challenge 2020 Part Eleven
Message:
Wow, there's been a real spurt of reading action at the end of this year - maybe a consequence of so many people being put into tier 4/unable to see family? I know I've been reading more than usual just to avoid the squabbling from the DCs...

Thank you very much for your thoughtful reviews, *Keith* - I really enjoyed reading them!

Thank you also to *southeastdweller* for keeping these threads going all year (and for heeding our pleas for a final 2020 one - I've got lots of reviews to catch up on and would feel weird putting them on a 2021 thread!)

I'm now on books 95 and 96 (and am wondering whether I can push through to 100 with a bit of judicious children's book reading, or whether this is a futile goal and I'm only cheating myself [grin]) so I'm going to update in batches as I can't face doing all of the reviews at once.

*The Carer by Deborah Moggach*
Enjoyably tart book about two late middle-aged siblings whose lives are turned upside-down when their father gets a new live-in carer. At first, Robert and Phoebe see Mandy as a complete â€œtreasureâ€ â€“ yes, sheâ€™s a bit â€œcommonâ€, but she seems devoted and enthusiastic about her work and they are relieved that they can pay her to do the caring that they donâ€™t want to/canâ€™t do themselves. But their father (an octogenarian professor emeritus of particle physics) seems to be changing oddly under Mandyâ€™s influence, and the siblings start to wonder if all is as it seemsâ€¦ Things come to a head halfway through the book (not in the way that Iâ€™d expected!) and all sorts of things come out of the woodwork; the second half of the book examines the fall-out and the events leading up to it from various perspectives. Iâ€™d assumed this was going to be a Sophie Hannah-style thriller with a devious â€œtwistâ€ but it wasnâ€™t like that at all. Instead, Moggach casts a rather beady eye on family relationships (between parents and children, between siblings, and between spouses), on ageing, and on the interplay between money, intelligence, success and opportunity. The characters are realistically unlikeable at times and, although thereâ€™s a certain amount of social satire going on, there isnâ€™t a lot of flab either. I enjoyed this a lot!

*The Deaths of December by Susi Holliday*
Competent police procedural that I bought in a charity shop last January and have been saving up for Christmas this year. A serial killer (referred to for most of the book as â€œThe Photographerâ€) sends a grisly advent calendar to the local CID; behind most of the doors is a photograph of a crime scene from an unsolved murder, which only the killer could have taken. Needless to say, there is also an elaborate code involved, linking dates, locations and numbered doors on the calendar. Can the police catch the killer before the last few empty doors are filled? (Yes, of course they can.) There was nothing earth-shattering about this book, but the writing was not terrible and the exploration of the charactersâ€™ back stories raised it above many other pot-boilers of this type.

*The Thirteen Days of Christmas by Jenny Overton*
A childhood favourite that I havenâ€™t read for ages, which was brought to mind recently by a conversation with DD (and I see that *ChessieFL* also read it very recently). I was fretting that it wouldnâ€™t live up to my memories of it, but I neednâ€™t have worried â€“ it was wonderful [smile]. The four Kitson children live with their widowed father Ralph; the oldest daughter, Anne (who prefers to be known as â€œAnnapleâ€ because she has romantic notions) is being wooed by the wealthy young merchant Francis Vere, but wonâ€™t have him because she feels that he is too prosaic. The younger three children conspire to get Annaple married off (partly because theyâ€™ve had enough of her terrible cooking), and egg Francis on to think of more and more ludicrously romantic gifts to present to Annaple on each of the twelve days of Christmas.

Like a lot of my favourite books from childhood (it was first published in 1974, and I would have read it in the mid-1980s), it involves a historical setting â€“ weirdly, this is never mentioned explicitly, but judging from Shirley Hughesâ€™ illustrations, I reckon itâ€™s some time in the second half of the 17th century. The setting, the understated period details and the spare but evocative language all meant that this was a magical read for me â€“ like *The Children of Green Knowe* and *The Dark is Rising*, both of which Iâ€™ve also just re-read. Like those books, it is really wonderful at evoking atmosphere â€“ each of the chapters is titled with the relevant feast for that day (so not just St Stephenâ€™s Day, but also Churching Day, Adamâ€™s Day, Eveâ€™s Day and Dancing Day). The celebrations and carols for that day frame the action, and give a real sense of Christmastide as a time for communal celebration rather than just personal feasting/present acquisition or sickly â€œfamily timeâ€ as modern books tend to emphasise. I donâ€™t know why itâ€™s taken me so long to re-read this (probably because it was in a box under my bed until a couple of months ago [blush]) but itâ€™s definitely going to be a regular re-read from now on!

*Dead Famous by Greg Jenner*
I started this months ago and then got bogged down and distracted by other books. Once Iâ€™d got going again, I flew through it! Itâ€™s an entertaining but fundamentally serious-minded look at the history of celebrity: when did we start to have â€œcelebritiesâ€, what is the difference between â€œcelebrityâ€, â€œfameâ€ and â€œnotorietyâ€, and how did people become (and stay) famous in the past? There are loads of colourful and entertaining anecdotes, as you would expect, but there is also a serious attempt to grapple with cultural theory and to put it in its proper context (as the historical consultant for Horrible Histories, I reckon Greg Jenner is probably uniquely suited to this job). Chapters cover the routes to stardom, money, celebrity bodies and merchandise, and everything is meticulously referenced (he mentions in the epilogue that it took him 6 years and 1.4 million words of notes to put this book together, and I believe it â€“ it even spills over [[https://www.gregjenner.com/dead-famous-full-references-bibliography/ onto his website]]!). Among the more obvious suspects like Byron, Lizst and WG Grace, you get to find out about the now-forgotten stars of their age, like the firebrand Tory clergyman Henry Sacheverell (arguably the first modern â€œcelebrityâ€), the sultry dancer ClÃ©o de MÃ©rode (whose affair with King Leopold of Belgium led to the brilliant portmanteau nickname ClÃ©opold, and whose fans were creepily obsessed with her ears), the â€œdivine Master Bettyâ€ (a Regency child star who was a cross between Shirley Temple and The Beatles), and, er, Clara the Rhino (who was the hottest star to tour 1740s Europe).

*A Christmas Carol by Charles Dickens*
Havenâ€™t read this for years, but it was a lovely way to spend Christmas/Boxing Day (I listened to the Hugh Grant version that Audible are giving away free at the moment). Iâ€™d forgotten how funny some of it is!

*Grimble and Grimble at Christmas by Clement Freud*
Another book I havenâ€™t read for at least 20 years! Grimble is a boy of about 10 (â€œYou may think it is silly to say someone is ^about^ ten, but Grimble had rather odd parents who were very vague and seldom got anything completely rightâ€). This book is really two long short-stories put together. In the first, Grimble comes home from school one Monday to find an empty house; his parents have left a globe with two flags stuck in it, one in England (saying â€œGRIMBLEâ€) and one in Peru (saying â€œUSâ€). Further notes around the house (his parents like leaving cryptic and sometimes trolling notes around the house) suggest five different people he can call on while they are away, from Colonel Featherstone to the station master. Each day, he calls on a different person, only to find that they are also mysteriously out and have left him notes with instructions on how to make dinner. In this way, he manages to spend the time until his parents return. The second half is about Grimbleâ€™s attempts to earn enough money for a â€œproperâ€ Christmas because he thinks that his parents will be too forgetful/disorganised to do it themselves (not quite as sad or neglectful as that makes it sound!).

The book is illustrated by Quentin Blake, and is a bizarre mixture of surreal humour and cookery advice (Clement Freud was both a food writer and an MP when he wrote this book) that was right up my street. To give you a flavour of it: [Grimbleâ€™s parents have sent him a telegram saying â€œTHINKING ABOUT YOU. MESSAGE IN THE IRONING CUPBOARD. DONâ€™T FORGET TEETH. LOVE FATHER AND MOTHER.â€]

â€œHe went up to the ironing cupboard, rummaged about a bit among the clothes, and finally in the pocket of his bathing trunks he found the message. It was written in green ink on a large squashed-fly biscuit and said, DO NOT EAT THIS BISCUIT BECAUSE EATING GREEN INK IS BAD FOR YOU. LOVE FATHER AND MOTHER. â€˜If that is a grown-up joke I am glad I am a child,â€™ though Grimble, brushed his teeth angrily, and looked at the list of people his parents had told him to go and see if he needed anything.â€

*Ruth's First Christmas Tree by Elly Griffiths*
I downloaded this 6 months ago as a [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Ruths-First-Christmas-Tree-Galloway-ebook/dp/B009P1WFEY?tag=mumsnetforu03-21 Kindle freebie]] and this seemed as good a time as any to read it. Itâ€™s a short story that is number 4.5 in the series, going between *A Room Full of Bones* and *A Dying Fall* (indeed, thereâ€™s a long excerpt from the latter at the end of this book). It was weird going back so far in the series now that Iâ€™m on book 12 and a lot has happened in Ruthâ€™s turbulent love/professional/crime-fighting life! The story itself is pretty short but sweet â€“ not the most enthralling mystery (in fact there are a couple of loose ends left untied) but a nice, easy, atmospheric read for fans of the series.

Title: Hit me with your stress busting tips that actually work!
Message:
As a pp said, I'd recommend Yoga with Adriene on You Tube. A lot of the practices are 10-15 mins long. There are specific ones for stress/anxiety, I did a great 10 min bedtime yoga one the other day too.

Trying to find 5 mins in the day to do mindful breathing will also work wonders - Look up 3-4-5 breathing or box breathing. Use free insight timer app to set a timer and ambient noise.

Also look up this [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Feel-Better-Your-Daily-Great/dp/0241397804/ref=sr_1_1?tag=mumsnetforu03-21 Dr Chaterjee Book]] It is a whole book of 5 minute 'health snacks' to improve your wellbeing. I've got all his books and listen to his podcast regularly, but for someone struggling to know where to start this is really accessible. He recommends picking 3 5 minute things to do each day, it would be an excellent start.
Cleaned_Message: said recommend yoga tube lot long specific stress anxiety great min bedtime yoga one day trying find day mindful breathing also work look breathing box breathing use free insight timer set timer ambient noise also look feel better daily great ref tag book whole book minute health improve got listen regularly someone struggling know start really accessible minute day would excellent start

Title: Books for 16yo on toxic behaviour in relationships?
Message:
My dd aged 17 and I have just finished this -

Mummyâ€™s Little Angels: A motherâ€™s agonising story of losing her sons to a murderous father [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/0091958571/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_G.28Fb5VBE5X3?tag=mumsnetforu03-21]]

Not sure if itâ€™s the right sort of thing but the poor womanâ€™s sons were murdered by her abusive husband who she got together with when she was just 16 (he was older). The majority of the book is about how he gradually controlled her more and more and how she didnâ€™t see it creeping up on her as she didnâ€™t recognise signs of early abuse. Well worth a read. The author is now an advocate against domestic violence. 

I actually think all teenagers 16 plus should read it.
Cleaned_Message: aged finished mummy little mother story losing sons murderous father ref tag sure right sort thing poor woman sons abusive husband got together older majority book gradually see creeping early abuse well worth read author advocate domestic violence actually think plus read

Title: Are Â£50 heated gloves worth the money?
Message:
The ones with heated fingers that I bought were a previous generation of these. Expensive but worth every penny. I managed 6 hours outdoors during The Beast From The East in the ones i have.  With my useless circulation, I struggle to unlock my door in normal gloves when the temperature is 1C.

[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Savior-Rechargeable-Battery-Motorcycle-Mountaineering/dp/B071WLPXHQ/ref=asc_df_B071WLPXHQ/?hvlocphy=9045878&linkCode=df0&hvptwo&psc=1&hvnetw=g&hvadid=309799295213&hvpone&hvlocint&hvpos&hvdev=c&hvdvcmdl&hvqmt&tag=mumsnetforu03-21&hvtargid=pla-444524216154&hvrand=15792563834469358751]]
Cleaned_Message: bought previous generation expensive worth every penny outdoors beast east useless circulation struggle unlock door normal temperature savior battery motorcycle ref tag

Title: Not to drive on unlit roads at night?
Message:
I agree with the looking slightly to the side to avoid being blinded by oncoming lights (I.e the edge of the road not away from your line of sight!), it makes a massive difference. I also bought some glasses similar to these:

Boolavard Night Sight Night Driving Over Glasses UV Wind P... [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B0776DVK5B/ref=cm_sw_r_sms_api_fabc_6MV-FbJJ05M33?psc=1&_encoding=UTF8&tag=mumsnetforu03-21]]

They work amazingly well. I still avoid driving in the dark when I can as I hate it, but using both of the above when itâ€™s unavoidable helps.
Cleaned_Message: agree looking slightly side avoid blinded oncoming edge road away line sight massive difference also bought glasses similar night sight night driving glasses wind ref tag work amazingly well still avoid driving dark hate unavoidable

Title: Have I a legal leg to stand on or should I wind my neck in?
Message: From an entirely practical point of view, I had dreadful trouble with ants (three different kinds including enormous black ones) in a place I used to live in, and this stuff sorted them. [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Vitax-Nippon-Ant-Killer-Liquid/dp/B009ZE2UDC/ref=pd_lpo_86_img_0/259-4470392-0353718?psc=1&pf_rd_p=7b8e3b03-1439-4489-abd4-4a138cf4eca6&_encoding=UTF8&pd_rd_wg=d601U&pf_rd_r=DZKRV23H5EXDXN6Q2R7C&pd_rd_i=B009ZE2UDC&pd_rd_w=7c3Bj&tag=mumsnetforu03-21&refRID=DZKRV23H5EXDXN6Q2R7C&pd_rd_r=9b5a9cd0-d823-4a81-9810-6c61ccbd3bf9]] You need to work out how they are getting into your flat, and put it in their path. It takes a week or two but it works. As it's cheap, you might ask the other people in the building if they would put it down too.

Title: Self Publishing- help!
Message:
Have confidence you had over 100k views online that's so awesome and I promise it will work in your favour. 

There's a really great book 'the complete handbook of novel writing' which is brilliant and covers everything you need to know about getting your book published. 

[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Complete-Handbook-Novel-Writing-3rd/dp/1440348391/ref=mp_s_a_1_2?dchild=1&keywords=the+complete+handbook+to+novel+writing&qid=1608163707&sr=8-2 https://www.amazon.co.uk/Complete-Handbook-Novel-Writing-3rd/dp/1440348391/ref=mp]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Complete-Handbook-Novel-Writing-3rd/dp/1440348391/ref=mp_s_a_1_2?dchild=1&keywords=the+complete+handbook+to+novel+writing&qid=1608163707&sr=8-2 s]]s_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Complete-Handbook-Novel-Writing-3rd/dp/1440348391/ref=mp_s_a_1_2?dchild=1&keywords=the+complete+handbook+to+novel+writing&qid=1608163707&sr=8-2 a]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Complete-Handbook-Novel-Writing-3rd/dp/1440348391/ref=mp_s_a_1_2?dchild=1&keywords=the+complete+handbook+to+novel+writing&qid=1608163707&sr=8-2 1]]1_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Complete-Handbook-Novel-Writing-3rd/dp/1440348391/ref=mp_s_a_1_2?dchild=1&keywords=the+complete+handbook+to+novel+writing&qid=1608163707&sr=8-2 2?dchild=1&keywords=the+complete+handbook+to+novel+writing&qid=1608163707&sr=8-2]]

I know you're probably excited to get it out there but once you publish it yourself you might find it harder to get it published by a publisher. Just think it through before you make any decisions

Title: EU postage and customs stickers
Message:
I had this from Amazon in early December:

'As you have placed an order on Amazon.co.uk and selected an EU delivery address in the past, we wanted to let you know that from 1 January 2021, when the Brexit transition period ends, youâ€™ll see some changes when you shop on Amazon.co.uk and select an EU delivery address. These changes could include:
- VAT (or the regional equivalent, if applicable, ... being due in the country of delivery, or your package may be subject to customs duties, taxes and fees (â€œImport Feesâ€)
- the collection of VAT, or an estimation of Import Fees ..., which may result in a price change at checkout.'

I don't yet know if this applies if I order from Amazon.fr or Amazon.de
Cleaned_Message: early order selected delivery address past let know transition period see shop select delivery address could include vat regional equivalent applicable due country delivery package may subject customs import collection vat estimation import may result price change yet know order

Title: What to do when you and DH fundamentally disagree about parenting
Message:
Buy him "Babies and Toddlers for Men" by Mark Woods ([[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/1905410913/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_Gi3XFbX12JG1F?tag=mumsnetforu03-21 Amazon link]]) and insist that he reads it.

DH argued a LOT after DC1 was born and we ended up having couple's counselling as things didn't improve. That helped us massively. Now DC2 is here we are arguing again so I suppose it's inevitable. I'm wondering whether we should have some "refresher" counselling. Anyway, don't know if that's helpful but you're not alone!

One thing that pisses me off is that I do all the research, I do obsessive Googling, asking friends for advice, reading Mumsnet thread, reading parenting books... but he does fuck all. I'm also the one doing the vast majority of the childcare (breastfeeding so doing night feeds and also on maternity leave while he works). So actually I get final say if we can't agree. If he doesn't like it, tough! I have told him that I'd like us to make parenting decisions as equal and he does have the right to a say so perhaps he could kindly educate himself and then we can have a conversation. Funnily enough he never fucking bothers. He does listen to me though thankfully. If he refused to listen or research I'd probably tell him to fuck off.

About your baby's digestive issues - sometimes they can be caused by cow's milk protein allergy (CMPA) although if your baby is tolerating formula that's probably unlikely. You mentioned that you had a c-section. Sometimes probiotics can help, BioGaia baby ones are good.

Hang on in there. I find the arguments one of the worst things about having a baby [sad] [flowers] But it does pass or at least it did in our case after a lot of counselling and just time as baby got older and easier to look after.
Cleaned_Message: buy men mark ref tag link insist lot born ended couple improve massively suppose inevitable wondering whether refresher anyway know helpful alone one thing research obsessive advice reading thread reading also one vast majority breastfeeding night also maternity leave works actually get final say agree like tough told like make equal right say perhaps could kindly educate conversation funnily enough never listen though thankfully listen research probably tell baby digestive sometimes cow milk protein allergy although baby formula probably unlikely section sometimes help baby good find one worst baby sad pass least case lot time baby got older easier look

Title: I keep having panic attacks and have no idea why
Message:
You are not a â€œfreakâ€, . Loads of people have panic attacks. Itâ€™s absolutely horrible, but it does not make you a freak. 

I canâ€™t recommend this book enough, there is also a linked work book.

[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Overcoming-Panic-2nd-behavioural-techniques/dp/1472135822?tag=mumsnetforu03-21]]

Thereâ€™s some basic advice on the NHS website: [[https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/stress-anxiety-depression/understanding-panic/]]

Thereâ€™s no magic cure, itâ€™s a matter of plodding through techniques that can help you manage them. I donâ€™t get them at all now.

Title: Sertraline - hand holding
Message:
Hi â€¦ yes, after about a week, I started to sleep better and Iâ€™m now sleeping like a 'normal person'.  I started on 50mg and kept on same dose.  Now day 16 and take it first thing in the morning. 

Also, I read a book recommended on Mumsnet and use the techniques from it... was amazing for me as someone who developed this insomnia anxiety issue:

[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Sleep-Book-Well-Every-Night/dp/1409149102?tag=mumsnetforu03-21]]

My sleep was absolutely awful before starting the sertraline, and I was getting anxiety attacks when awake at night.  Had to take time off work, stopped driving, ugh... horrible.  I can't believe how much my sleep has improved, I'm totally functional again rather than a sleep deprived zombie.

Hope things get better soon for you.
Cleaned_Message: yes week sleep better sleeping like normal person kept dose day take first thing morning also read book use amazing someone insomnia anxiety issue sleep book well every night tag sleep absolutely awful starting getting anxiety awake night take time work stopped driving ugh horrible believe much sleep totally functional rather sleep zombie hope get better soon

Title: August 2021 - Scans and booking in!
Message:
Here's the link to the book in case anyone wanted to look.

[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B08VC4WFDG?fbclid=IwAR25dedoZM5cS0qIsubt6sXZvBcHas3PFNzOciOYr7hcvADYREwg2G7rfUo&tag=mumsnetforu03-21]]

Expressing can be tricky but some people find it easy. I think the key is to remember that when you're expressing, you're really getting the "excess" milk. Babies are more efficient than a pump and when a baby is feeding, you're getting all kinds of biological feedback which signal to your body that your baby is feeding and hence make more milk. A pump only really recreates two of these signals - the removal of milk and the sucking action (nipple stimulation). What you don't have is oxytocin, skin to skin, the smell of your baby and the hormonal feedback. You can often train your body to produce more by expressing regularly, indeed, that's what happens when someone exclusively pumps milk or pumps a large proportion of their baby's milk. But if you don't pump regularly, then you'll find as your milk supply regulates over the first 3-6 months and you stop leaking etc, you'll stop producing excess and then if you want to express after this point, you'll probably find you don't produce anything for the pump any more. It is then possible to increase pumping supply, but if you just want to do it as and when for the odd evening out etc, I (personally) found that wasn't really possible after about 6 months.

A lot of people like the idea of expressing for a bottle for their partner to feed, in reality I think this can end up being more work for you than you save by having your partner do one feed! Especially if you end up responsible for cleaning and sterilising the pump and bottle, organising storage of the milk, etc. OTOH, if you find you leak a lot, you can use breast shells or there's a "passive" pump out now called a Haakaa, which can be used to collect run-off milk that you're leaking, for example during feeding your baby, which is a common time to leak. This can then be decanted into a bottle to use as an extra feed, which can be no effort at all! But it doesn't work for everyone. I didn't leak a lot with DS1 and not at all with DS2.

I don't think nipple confusion is as big of an issue as people seem to think it is. Maybe for very tiny babies who are still learning to latch. I suppose it's good to be aware of it as a potential problem, but I def wouldn't get too hung up on it. OTOH a lot of people think if they introduce a bottle too late, then babies won't take to them at all but I don't think this is true either. Bottle refusal just seems to be a random thing that some babies decide to do at about 3-4 months old, and they will do it whether they have had a bottle beforehand or not.

I would say that 10+ hour cluster feeding sessions are rare (and tend to spread into the night if that happens anyway). If it gets too much at any point, you can always just put the baby down and go to another room. Yes, they might cry, but even if what they really want is milk, dads or other people can develop calming strategies for babies all of their own, and if there really is nobody else, they will be OK while you get your breath back for 5 minutes. Cluster feeding is common, but it's normally more like 2-3 hours at a time in the early evening, at a time when you generally want to be sat on your bum watching TV anyway, so it's not tooo bad to be immobile, it can be quite a nice excuse! Or set up your bed for safe co-sleeping (even if you don't want to do this as their main sleep space) and doze. Buy your partner a cookery book now if they don't currently cook [wink], batch cook for the freezer during late pregnancy and getting acquainted with a slow cooker and your local takeaways is also not a bad idea, because it does tend to happen right at tea time and breastfeeding makes you hungry. Cluster feeding is wearing but I think if you're expecting it, it's not quite as bad as if you are expecting them to feed for 10 minutes and then be put down for the next 2-4 hours.

Midwives in theory should be able to help you with establishing feeding, but unfortunately they don't all have good training or experience with BF... sometimes their advice can be really good, but sometimes it can be incomplete. I'd recommend that anyone who wants to BF locates a source near them which is reliable - whether that's a book or helpline or a support group or an IBCLC - it's just unfortunately a bit of a postcode lottery and a lot of NHS areas don't have breastfeeding support on staff, other than the very basic training midwives have (which might have been years ago and half forgotten). Health visitors aren't usually trained in breastfeeding, and neither are GPs. Hospitals tend to want you out ASAP even in normal times because they need the beds! But you should get midwife home visits up to about day 10 before being discharged back to HV.

Sorry this ended up really long...

Title: 9DPO Symptom Spotting
Message:
I got good news this morning. HPV letter arrived!! The spotting made me start googling 'signs of cervical cancer' because at this point, my body may just straight-up hate me but at least I'm infection free. Yay! The spotting is settling down now anyway and should hopefully stop tomorrow so we can start with DTD. I also booked an appointment at the fertility clinic for DH and I. We'll be going next Tuesday! Wish us luck!! Have you started looking into fertility checks?

I haven't changed my vitamins but maybe I need to stop or cut back? I could take the B-complex for now and stop everything else. But I don't really think it's the vitamins. It's defo hormonal and it's semen or conception or failed-implantation induced - just not sure which one.

I'm right here with you with all the alcohol drinking. I've had a drink everyday since Xmas. We've also been sleeping and waking up late - only God (and DH) knows what my temps are doing. Hopefully you're able to see a clear temp shift despite it all. I'm still a week away from ovulation!

Haha I ordered [[https://www.amazon.com/FertilAid-Men-Fertility-Supplement-Morphology/dp/B0006HDOSM?tag=mumsnetforu03-21 these]] for him as well as the ones for sperm count and motility (just in case). They have really good reviews but I only thought he'd need to take three separate pills, not 3 of one, 2 of another and 2 of another. Oh well! The things we do to keep the wife happy.

Haha I can imagine your DP begrudgingly wearing the PJs. But like I said... The things we do to keep the wife (or fiancee) happy ðŸ˜‚ Me too! PJs all day everyday. I actually ordered five more so that I had a nice rotation available.

A maxi dress would definitely be what I'd go for too with that fabric - so pretty! I think you should leave it baggy and create a waist belt for it. That way you can tighten it around your waist but have the loose, flowy look too.

I've started using visualisers to see what rugs and tiles would look like in the new house. I really like this beige rug. I think it suits the floorboards and the fireplace. And the bathroom currently has blue floor tiles which I want to paint a dark grey/slate colour. But I still don't like the blue trim on the walls so might replace them. What do you think?
Cleaned_Message: got good news morning letter spotting made start cervical cancer point body may straight hate least infection free spotting settling anyway hopefully stop tomorrow start also booked appointment fertility clinic going next wish luck looking fertility maybe need stop cut back could take complex stop everything else really think hormonal semen conception implantation induced sure one right alcohol drinking drink everyday since also sleeping waking late god hopefully able see clear temp shift despite still week away ovulation ordered men fertility supplement morphology tag well sperm count motility case really good thought need take three separate one another another well keep wife happy imagine begrudgingly wearing like said keep wife fiancee happy day everyday actually ordered five nice rotation available dress would definitely fabric pretty think leave baggy create waist belt way tighten around waist loose look see would look like new house really like beige rug think fireplace bathroom currently blue floor want paint dark grey slate colour still like blue trim might replace think

Title: 9DPO Symptom Spotting
Message:
Yay! Go temps go! Glad it's progressing so well for you! Fingers crossed for a longer LP and highest temps ever! Just checked your overlay chart and these are your highest temps at 7DPO so far! How exciting! My temp did exactly what it did last cycle. At 5DPO it flattened and I have a flat temp today as well. It might start going up from tomorrow. I'm thinking secondary estrogen surge keeping my temps down?

Oooooo imagine if you have a little bean in there right now searching for the perfect spot to snuggle into!!! Hopefully over the next few days, your temps will shoot up ðŸ“ˆ I know charts can't show or predict pregnancy so early on but it'll be really interesting to see what happens.

I'm feeling a bit bleh this morning. Have a bit of a headache. I've been having them on and off over the last few days. Quite tired too so feeling a bit groggy. My leg is much better! I asked DH to give me a massage last night and he decided to unleash the strength of a thousand oxen onto it, nearly took my skin off - but it must have worked! I guess the pain was muscular ðŸ¤·â€â™€ï¸ symptom spotting isn't fun when there's a logical explanation ðŸ˜¢ðŸ˜‚ I'll need to remember to do my progesterone test tomorrow too!

If I get a BFP this cycle, I want to buy [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B07Z3Y5ZP4/ref=ox_sc_act_title_2?smid=A2RCXAQDK3T42M&psc=1&tag=mumsnetforu03-21 this box]] and put the HPT inside it and give it to DH on Valentine's Day. It's such an overdone thing to do but I think Valentine's Day would be the least suspicious time to do it because people generally exchange gifts then (although the box shape might be a dead giveaway. I'll have to choose another shape.) Would you tell your DP straight away if you got a BFP or wait until Val's Day?

I remember when my mum was pregnant with my siblings. Excess saliva was one of her symptoms. She used to carry around a bottle to spit in ðŸ¤¢ I really hope I don't get that!! Do you remember any of your mums symptoms through her pregnancies?

I *could* sleep on my side if I tried. I seem to go through cycles where my sleeping position changes. I used to sleep on my side quite a lot but for some reason, I prefer my front now and can't sleep on my side anymore. But those pregnancy pillow sound like a dream! I'll take two please! 

I can't remember tbh, it couldn't have been too long after we started dating. The full story is now one of those stories you tell amongst friends and laugh your head off. I wish it was my most embarrassing story too, but I've had worse happen to me. What's the most embarrassing thing to ever happen to you?

The funny thing is, I have the biggest boobs in my family (so far, as my little cousin seems to be catching up) I think it's from the paternal side of me. My sisters and I have different dads and they're both flat chested. Is there a feature that all your family members have inherited? In my family, it's our lack of a bum and waist. We're not a very shapely family - we're all very boxy ðŸ“¦ðŸ˜‚

He has an exercise bike too! He doesn't use it. That's why I'm even more annoyed ðŸ˜  If we created an outdoor gym, that would be great because then the equipment would have a dedicated space. I want to buy [[https://billyoh.com/tessa-summerhouse/26233 this]]. We have a hot tub too so I'd be looking to put it inside something like [[https://billyoh.com/holly-summerhouse/26099 this]]. Then at least we'd have a gym area for fitness and relaxation (obviously I won't be using the hot tub as I don't go inside water). Since you have a big garden, you could erect an outdoor building. It might be cold in winter without any insulation but a cool environment is great when you're working out â„ï¸ðŸ¥¶

ðŸ˜±ðŸ˜± What! Sleep can affect fertility. That's crazy! The body has to be a perfect system or else, it seems, if something is out of balance, it can impact other areas of the body ðŸ˜± Gosh, there seems to be 1001 reasons for infertility and pinpointing it must be impossible. Can't believe 10 years of bad sleep caused this!! But she finally got her happily ever after. Hopefully my LP-induced insomnia is mostly caused by anxiety and not me waking up a million times in the night ðŸ˜±

Title: OH teasing daughter
Message:
You could gently point him in the direction of some decent parenting books that deal with the topic.

[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/1848123094/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_THG1S0PV35FH88PTHHN1?tag=mumsnetforu03-21 How to Talk so Kids Will Listen and Listen so Kids Will Talk]] is really, really good and helped me with kids from toddlers through to teens.  

By â€œgentlyâ€ I mean get a physical copy of the book, read it yourself, keep going on about how amazing it is and how it is helping YOUR parenting, and then suggest he might like it.
Cleaned_Message: could gently point direction decent deal topic ref tag talk listen listen talk really really good teens gently mean get physical copy book read keep going amazing helping suggest might like

Title: Feb 2021 Â£10/day. February, let's round off winter!
Message:
Does anyone here do MTurk? I signed up to it years ago but got really into it over the past couple of years - payments are to your Amazon.com giftcard balance, which worked for me because I was travelling to the US and used it to buy things when I was there (you can also use it to order stuff to be posted to the UK, but shipping and customs take a chunk) but I think now there's an option to be paid in actual money. 

Mostly I got into it because it felt a lot more productive when I felt a bit anxious than arguing with people on Twitter [grin]. Hoping we do get to travel this year so I can spend the results of dealing with anxiety productively [grin]

Title: I like the idea of a â€˜wellness journeyâ€™
Message:
There are loads out there! 

[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Unlock-Magic-Manifesting-manifestation-co-create/dp/1916114784/ref=mp_s_a_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=28+manifesting+journal&qid=1611404865&sr=8-1 https://www.amazon.co.uk/Unlock-Magic-Manifesting-manifestation-co-create/dp/1916114784/ref=mp]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Unlock-Magic-Manifesting-manifestation-co-create/dp/1916114784/ref=mp_s_a_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=28+manifesting+journal&qid=1611404865&sr=8-1 s]]s_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Unlock-Magic-Manifesting-manifestation-co-create/dp/1916114784/ref=mp_s_a_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=28+manifesting+journal&qid=1611404865&sr=8-1 a]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Unlock-Magic-Manifesting-manifestation-co-create/dp/1916114784/ref=mp_s_a_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=28+manifesting+journal&qid=1611404865&sr=8-1 1]]1_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Unlock-Magic-Manifesting-manifestation-co-create/dp/1916114784/ref=mp_s_a_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=28+manifesting+journal&qid=1611404865&sr=8-1 1?dchild=1&keywords=28+manifesting+journal&qid=1611404865&sr=8-1]]

This is the one I got an I followed her page on Facebook and watched several of her videos reinforcing the principles and a lot just clicked for me. 

The main thing for me was getting over overwhelm. If so much is going on you feel in a constant state of overwhelm whether it's house work, work/business, diy, weight issues, exercise, children and other negative thoughts, then how can you expect more to come into your life even if it's good.

You don't have space for it.

Title: Weaning! Any advice welcome
Message:
I would recommend two books to start with, none is a cookbook 
[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/First-Bite-How-Learn-Eat/dp/0007549725/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&crid=3AJGZZOKRD13W&keywords=first+bite+bee+wilson&sprefix=first+bites+bee%2Caps%2C427&tag=mumsnetforu03-21&qid=1612917287&sr=8-1]] 
and 
[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Dental-Diet-Surprising-between-Life-Changing/dp/1781809305/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&crid=356SAP5EDXS8J&keywords=dental+diet+book&sprefix=dental+diet%2Caps%2C425&tag=mumsnetforu03-21&qid=1612917317&sr=8-1]]

You have the unique opportunity to shape your baby's taste. Focus on the food you want him/her growing up eating. You want your baby to eat vegetables , give vegetables, and stay away from ultra processed baby food (puffs, veggie sticks, baby crisps, cereal bars, ....). 
Even minimally processed baby food should;d be the exception and not the rule. 
Be mindful that pouches and jars don't taste like their fresh food equivalent, and a baby will develop a preference for the taste that is given. A lot of pouches also have sweetness as a dominating taste, so use sweet veggies such as carrot, sweetcorn or add fruit to veggies to make it more palatable. 
Baby porridge is very sweet.

The main point will always be to focus on the food, not how it reaches the mouth (spoon or finger). The industry has jumped on this concept that you need "finger food" for development and offers a wide range of highly processed addictive food. 
Read a bit about nutrition and how important it is to offer variety and diversity of taste and texture. 
It doesn't have to be the spoon. or the finger. I use my fingers for blueberries but a spoon for soups. 
You need to talk with your partner about what would be the best food for your child to eat, what you wouldn't want them to be and plan their weaning accordingly
Cleaned_Message: would recommend two start none cookbook first bite learn eat ref first bite bee first bee tag dental diet surprising life ref sap dental diet book dental diet tag unique opportunity shape baby taste focus food want growing eating want baby eat give stay away ultra baby food sticks baby cereal even minimally baby food exception rule mindful taste like fresh food equivalent baby develop preference taste given lot also sweetness taste use sweet carrot add fruit make palatable baby porridge sweet main point always focus food mouth spoon finger industry concept need finger food development wide range highly food read bit nutrition important offer variety diversity taste texture spoon finger use spoon need talk partner would best food child eat want plan accordingly

Title: Cambridge/Exante/Slimfast 2021
Message:
New thread combining all the VLC shake diets: Cambridge, Exante, Lighterlife, Slimfast, etc. Everyone is welcome. 

*If you have any underlying health conditions, please check with your GP first (as I did).*

I'm doing Slimfast (two shakes and one healthy meal a day). I use the premade shakes, because I actually like them! They are currently on sale here: [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/SlimFast-Replacement-Shake-Chunky-Chocolate/dp/B010PM6XO4/?tag=mumsnetforu03-21]]

I noticed Amazon is selling Lighterlife products now, too, if that helps anyone: [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/stores/page/DCB0D716-63B4-4265-8862-CF4AEEE9FEF9?tag=mumsnetforu03-21]]

My goals:

- Get two stone off quickly, then swap to less restrictive healthy/calorie controlled eating.
- Do 30 minutes of exercise (walking, jogging, lifting weights, whatever) a day.

Would love to share tips and motivate each other as we go!

Title: Yogurt pot yuppies, sexy basters and UFO discs - part 3
Message:
Welcome and thank you for joining us! ðŸ˜˜
In terms of soft cups, there are two options that would work for our purpose:
1) Single use soft discs, called Instead Cups [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B000X29GY6/ref=cmswrcpapifabc6JQN2F922FYYS794Q7VB https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B000X29GY6/ref=cm]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B000X29GY6/ref=cmswrcpapifabc6JQN2F922FYYS794Q7VB sw]]w_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B000X29GY6/ref=cmswrcpapifabc6JQN2F922FYYS794Q7VB r]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B000X29GY6/ref=cmswrcpapifabc6JQN2F922FYYS794Q7VB cp]]p_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B000X29GY6/ref=cmswrcpapifabc6JQN2F922FYYS794Q7VB api]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B000X29GY6/ref=cmswrcpapifabc6JQN2F922FYYS794Q7VB fabc]]c_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B000X29GY6/ref=cmswrcpapifabc6JQN2F922FYYS794Q7VB 6JQN2F922FYYS794Q7VB]]
2) Reusable soft discs, such as the ziggy cup [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B079JYJBF2/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_EY4VCRFTG2VDSJMTYNGA?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B079JYJBF2/ref=cm]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B079JYJBF2/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_EY4VCRFTG2VDSJMTYNGA?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 sw]]w_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B079JYJBF2/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_EY4VCRFTG2VDSJMTYNGA?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 r]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B079JYJBF2/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_EY4VCRFTG2VDSJMTYNGA?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 cp]]p_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B079JYJBF2/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_EY4VCRFTG2VDSJMTYNGA?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 api]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B079JYJBF2/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_EY4VCRFTG2VDSJMTYNGA?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 fabc]]c_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B079JYJBF2/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_EY4VCRFTG2VDSJMTYNGA?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 EY4VCRFTG2VDSJMTYNGA?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1]]

Both of these cups have a flat design, so they surround the cervix with their rim and sit flat against it. Menstrual cups sit at the top of the vaginal canal, still close but not as close to the cervix. Also, menstrual cups have a shape that allows them to collect liquids, so it might be more difficult for sperm to escape. The fertilily cup, I honestly don't see the point of because, sure, it will keep semen close to the cervix after intercourse but, given that we use SI, best to have two birds with one stone imho. ðŸ˜‰ 

I personally prefer that DH ejaculates straight into the soft disc and I insert it immediately, within the first 10 seconds. That way, I know that the semen is as fresh as possible and has not been handled at all by swirling it, leaving it to liquify, sucking it with a syringe. All these understandably damage the sperm. So, all in all, I agree with your DP!

Title: Support thread for those experiencing or recently experienced a MC/MMC - Thread 2. ALL welcome!
Message:
Morning all!

I'm sorry I've been MIA, I've just been all consumed by my desperation to ovulate so I'm in with a chance! 

To recap for anyone newer, I had my MVA on the 14th January. So just over three weeks ago! I'm getting vvvfl on FRER and Wondfo cheapies - just a side note here, the Wondfo cheapies are just as sensitive as the FRERs?! And a million times cheaper haha!! They're advertised as 20mIU but I swear they must be at least 10 if not closer to the FRER level of 6... Lines are tracking the same on both. 

So I'm CD 23 today and my temp has finally dropped quite a bit! So think I may ovulate tomorrow possibly? I think it tends to follow that trend. Have been DTD every other day so ðŸ¤žðŸ»


Sorry I've not properly read through all the new joiners but I'm so glad you've found this support group as everyone's so friendly and just all round lovely! And I definitely recommend these tests if you want to obsessively pee on sticks every other day to track your line regression like I did... â¤ï¸ 


Wondfo Pregnancy Test Strips Early Detection 20xOne Step Pregnancy Tests for Home Self-Checking [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B081N9B9VQ/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_K9W9VR0N5RX5NPX41HNH?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B081N9B9VQ/ref=cm]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B081N9B9VQ/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_K9W9VR0N5RX5NPX41HNH?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 sw]]w_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B081N9B9VQ/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_K9W9VR0N5RX5NPX41HNH?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 r]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B081N9B9VQ/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_K9W9VR0N5RX5NPX41HNH?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 cp]]p_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B081N9B9VQ/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_K9W9VR0N5RX5NPX41HNH?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 api]][[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B081N9B9VQ/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_K9W9VR0N5RX5NPX41HNH?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 fabc]]c_[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B081N9B9VQ/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_fabc_K9W9VR0N5RX5NPX41HNH?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 K9W9VR0N5RX5NPX41HNH?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1]]

Title: Night Sweats
Message:
My night sweats are a lot better than before and I don't use hrt. I have switched to 100 percent cotton bedsheets. I also use cotton quilt with natural cotton fibres instead of polyester filled duvets much like [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Vihaan-Impex-Exclusive-Reversible-Rajasthani/dp/B019MY9CGC/ref=pd_aw_sbs_201_1/259-6637178-3132941?psc=1&pf_rd_p=d441cb92-c8c6-4d79-9dce-6f0e9a9b0249&_encoding=UTF8&pd_rd_wg=OfxxH&pf_rd_r=47FAVEHF1602YTJN1NQX&pd_rd_i=B019MY9CGC&pd_rd_w=nHgaz&tag=mumsnetforu03-21&refRID=47FAVEHF1602YTJN1NQX&pd_rd_r=a16cfe64-375f-4fb7-b8f3-a94d4921851b]].
A lot of women use woollen blankets and found them good but I cannot personally comment.
For supplements I have tried two- soya isoflavones which did not make any difference at all and second was Himalaya evecare which has Ashoka. Ashoka has natural estrogen properties. I found evecare much more helpful for night sweats and it also regulated my periods.
I did stop using it after 2 months so can't say about long term benefits.
Cleaned_Message: night lot better use switched percent cotton also use cotton quilt natural cotton instead polyester filled much like exclusive reversible ref tag lot use found good cannot personally comment tried two soya make difference second natural estrogen found much helpful night also regulated stop say long term

Title: Practicalities of a no deal Brexit for Ireland
Message:
I just got an e-mail from Amazon saying that there could be some changes as a result of Brexit.  It says, 

"These changes could include:

- VAT (or the regional equivalent, if applicable, [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/vatrates)?tag=mumsnetforu03-21]] being due in the country of delivery, or your package may be subject to customs duties, taxes and fees (â€œImport Feesâ€)
- the collection of VAT, or an estimation of Import Fees (â€œImport Fee Depositâ€ [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/ifd)?tag=mumsnetforu03-21]], which may result in a price change at checkout.

We will continue to accept eligible returns. If the reason for return is the result of an error (e.g. if the item is defective / damaged / incorrect), any costs incurred for the return will be paid by Amazon. Otherwise, any costs incurred for the return (including transport costs, as well as any associated import fees or customs where applicable) will be payable by the person returning the goods [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/returnshelp."]]

Generally speaking, I don't order a huge amount from Amazon although I did order a fair bit during the first lockdown, because so many shops were closed here.  I did my best to order Christmas presents from Irish retailers - either online or using click and collect.

Anyway, there's not enough detail in the e-mail to determine if it will cost extra to order from Amazon going forward and if so, how much extra?  Also, I think I read that Amazon are setting up warehouses here.  Will there be an amazon.ie?
Cleaned_Message: got mail saying could result could include vat regional equivalent applicable tag due country delivery package may subject customs import collection vat estimation import import fee deposit tag may result price change continue accept eligible reason return result error item defective incorrect return otherwise return transport well associated import customs applicable payable person goods generally speaking order huge amount although order fair bit first many closed best order either click collect anyway enough detail mail determine cost extra order going forward much extra also think read setting

Title: Explaining loss/death to a small child
Message:
I'm very sorry for your loss OP. 

I agree that you should say that your df died and this means their body doesn't work any more, they can't think any more, they can't see or hear or feel. 

[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/When-Dinosaurs-Die-Understanding-Families/dp/0316119555?tag=mumsnetforu03-21 This is a good book]] to explain death to your 5yo. 

Also Badgers Parting Gift would be good although hard to read without crying.

Title: Gift for a newly converted Muslim
Message:
If I was gifting, I'd give it as a we support you gift rather than a Xmas gift and make that clear to him because I understand reverts can either ease in or sometimes be harder on themselves at the start so you may not want him to think you are against his choice, as Muslims (who go back to basics) see Christmas as the belief of Jesus being God/son of God at the root which he won't want to 'celebrate'. 

But just seen the hangover part. He might be saying that as an excuse to not come and participate in Xmas and not offend you at the same time as he's learning how to communicate with you, or he's serious but if he's serious we wouldn't judge him, as he's new to Islam so baby steps!

You can just do a simple hamper type thing, like get a glass bottle of pure juice, Tony's chocolate (larger Sainsbury's have them), a large bag of salt n vinegar crisps (tk maxx has loads that look fancy), something he may use that you know as his sister like I dunno a winter scarf or something. 
This book is nice [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Title-Reflections-Pearls-Concise-Comprehensive/dp/0972835857/ref=mp_s_a_1_3?dchild=1&s=books&tag=mumsnetforu03-21&qid=1608600693&refinements=p_27%3AAbdur-Rahman+Ibn+Yusuf&sr=1-3]]
Glass peanut butter jar? They have them in all supermarkets, a natural one. 
A jar of local honey.
Jam
A nice pack of nuts?
You can't go wrong with food lol.

That sort of thing. You will know what he likes better. Add some tissue paper and it will look nice. Write a little message saying this gift is because we support you on your journey... and in person say it's not an Xmas gift. 

Someone said a carved wooden Qur'an holder. That's a good idea. There's a shop called Islamic impressions. They have a nice one for Â£5 in store, can't see it online. You can call them up. They have free delivery when you spend Â£10 and lots of things on their website. 

It's really nice of you to think of him and want to remember him always. Remember random thoughts throughout the year are nice and from a Muslim perspective better than focusing on one day in a year. I'm sure he'll appreciate it whenever you give it although he probably won't expect anything. Kind words go a long way.
Cleaned_Message: give support gift rather gift make clear understand either ease sometimes harder start may want think choice back see belief god son god root want celebrate seen part might saying excuse come participate offend time learning communicate serious serious judge new baby simple hamper type thing like get glass bottle pure juice tony chocolate large bag salt vinegar look fancy something may use know sister like winter scarf something book nice title concise comprehensive ref tag glass peanut butter jar natural one jar local honey jam nice pack wrong food sort thing know better add tissue paper look nice write little message saying gift support journey person say gift someone said wooden holder good idea shop nice one store see call free delivery spend lots really nice think want remember always remember random throughout year nice perspective better one day year sure appreciate whenever give although probably expect anything kind long way

Title: Maths addition and subtraction
Message:
That's a mistake.  Its proven even top set pupils learn better mastery using concrete objects for the initial stages of learning.  It greatly improves conceptual understanding and numeracy.

For what you need I'd just use something as simple as these:

[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Learning-Resources-Mathlink-Cubes-Set/dp/B000URL296/ref=redir_mobile_desktop?hsa_cr_id=9480179130302&ref_=sbx_be_s_sparkle_mcd_asin_0&tag=mumsnetforu03-21&ie=UTF8&aaxitk=V..sso-RnyAdqO8.EPrPEw]]


If you are looking for a book, I'd recommend year 2A Maths No Problem.  It has a lot of partitioning problems with picture guides to aid comprehension.  

Don't worry though, some kids struggle with these types of bridging exercises but it is good for them to learn them as it helps with mental math skills.

Hope that helps!

Title: House with two children
Message:
We had a dining room and limited toys to an 8 cube kallax in there, plus a couple of bits in bedrooms. 

In bedrooms when they were little we had something a bit like [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/aw/d/B01LXT251D/ref=psdcmw_2850840031_t2_B07G4G1PWY?tag=mumsnetforu03-21 this]] but you can absolutely store more in bedrooms if you want to. Get them good solid single beds with good quality, solid based drawers underneath, or use a wardrobe for all their clothes and a trofast or similar for toys. 

I think the key is to be judicious in what toys you buy and rotate things to the downstairs. They don't need a farm and a doll's house and a fire station and an airport and a toy garage, they can do a lot with a couple of carefully chosen ones and perhaps some extra cardboard boxes. Or if they're into dollies they don't need bunk beds and a pram and a buggy and a high chair and a car seat. Get them lots of small accessories (bottles, a real spoon and bowl, rattle, their own outgrown baby clothes and blankets), a fold up buggy, and teach them to use the actual furniture/ cardboard boxes/drawers etc to pretend the bigger stuff. And make tidy up time a habit every evening.
Cleaned_Message: dining room limited cube plus couple little something bit like ref tag absolutely store want get good solid single good quality solid based drawers underneath use wardrobe clothes similar think key judicious buy rotate downstairs need farm doll house fire station airport toy garage lot couple carefully chosen perhaps extra cardboard need bunk pram buggy high chair car seat get lots small real spoon bowl rattle baby clothes fold buggy teach use actual furniture cardboard drawers pretend bigger stuff make tidy time habit every evening

Title: Red spots on DDs face. Eczema?
Message:
Perhaps try sodium lauryl sulfate (SLS) free shampoo. Nizoral is high in sulfates so that might be causing the dryness and irritation on forehead and sides of face. Itâ€™s actually fairly common for people to react to SLS in shampoo. My 16yo DD does and so uses baby shampoo. 

Stop using any face wash. Just use water. Until skin settles down. 

The moisturising cream Cerave contains petrolatum which is a known comedogenic that causes blocked pores/spots and so thatâ€™s probably why the cream resulted in spots emerging.  

You could try something gentler like pure aloe Vera gel which will moisturise and soothe without adding oils to her face. 
[[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Jason-Natural-Products-Super-Moisturizing/dp/B00014E1EQ/ref=sr_1_5?dchild=1&keywords=jason+aloe+vera&tag=mumsnetforu03-21&qid=1607635118&sr=8-5]]
Cleaned_Message: perhaps try sodium lauryl free shampoo high might causing dryness irritation forehead sides face actually fairly common people react shampoo baby shampoo stop face wash use water skin cream petrolatum known blocked probably cream could try something like pure aloe vera gel soothe without face natural super ref aloe vera tag

Title: So cold at school
Message:
The trick is wool clothing. So wool base layer (thighs and long sleeved top, something like this [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Mountain-Warehouse-Thermal-Baselayer-Trousers/dp/B07MGDXGM9/ref=mp_s_a_1_2_sspa?dchild=1&smid=A3W3NOJVUUSUGG&psc=1&keywords=merino+thermal+children&spLa=ZW5jcnlwdGVkUXVhbGlmaWVyPUFITTM5NUdCR1NLTTcmZW5jcnlwdGVkSWQ9QTA2ODIzNTlBMEY2SU1FWk5INVAmZW5jcnlwdGVkQWRJZD1BMDI0MTc3MzNIRFVSOUZTQkJVT0omd2lkZ2V0TmFtZT1zcF9waG9uZV9zZWFyY2hfYXRmJmFjdGlvbj1jbGlja1JlZGlyZWN0JmRvTm90TG9nQ2xpY2s9dHJ1ZQ==&tag=mumsnetforu03-21&qid=1607534253&sr=8-2-spons]] ) and then a thick wool sweater on top.  They should be allowed wool hats and scarves as well. 

Ridiculous that they have to wear uniform, they should just be able to wear whatever it takes to keep warm. It must be so miserable. I canâ€™t imagine government offices making their staff be so cold while working?
Cleaned_Message: trick wool clothing wool base layer long sleeved top something like mountain warehouse thermal trousers ref thermal wag tag thick wool sweater top wool well ridiculous wear uniform able wear whatever keep warm must miserable imagine government making staff cold working

Title: 7 month old feeding all night
Message:
If she'll be 9 months when you go back, there's really no need for bottles.  She'll probably be happy with a BF on wake up, one on pick up and one before bed.  As she'll probably hit the 9 month sleep regression, she may wake in the night for one too.

Doing that along with formula or ebm in a cup and solids will be fine at Nursery.

As for the many wakings.  It's pretty normal at this age but she may be Reverse Cycling.  

Have a try of doing Breast Compressions on the day and offering her a feed every 2 hours.  It might get her used to taking her calories in the day instead of at night.

The [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/No-Cry-Sleep-Solution-Second/dp/1260462129 No Cry Sleep Solution]] might help to sort out her sleep before you return to work too and unlike sone baby sleep books, this one is evidence based [smile]
Cleaned_Message: back really need probably happy wake one pick one bed probably hit month sleep regression may wake night one along formula cup fine nursery many pretty normal age may reverse cycling try breast day offering feed every might get used taking day instead night cry sleep solution second cry sleep solution might help sort sleep return work unlike baby sleep one evidence based smile

Title: If i ordered something from Amazon which is sold by Amazon_EU would i have to pay tax/customs?
Message:
No you won't. 

You are purchasing from Amazon.co.uk and it's not your issue where they dispatch the item from so there will be no costs. 

I've ordered a few bits the last two weeks dispatched for Amazon EU sarl and they've arrived next day with no charges.

Title: Please give me the strength to adopt ex dps dog.
Message:
With regards to the bin raiding, your job is to make it as inconvenient as possible for him to bin raid.
- keep him away from the bins (baby gate on the kitchen door?) 
- locking bins - these are good [[https://smile.[[amazon.co.uk/dp/B004WIZAII/ref=cm_sw_r_u_apa_fabc_N37ENMYJB131EYATFAM9?psc=1&_encoding=UTF8&tag=mumsnetforu03-21 amazon.co.uk/dp/B004WIZAII/ref=cm_sw_r_u_apa_fabc_N37ENMYJB131EYATFAM9?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1]]]]
- weights in the bottom to make it harder to tip the bin over (bricks! Literal bricks!) 

Sock eating - this is literally a case of keeping them away from him. 

Waiting on the mat - can he do a sit reliably on command? If so, I would train a sit every time he comes through that door (even in summer when it's dry!) and give a treat every time. 

Walk the dog away from other dogs - reactivity is a pig to sort in dogs of any age, and at this age I can't see you making meaningful progress. 

Have you managed to get the abscess sorted yet? The pain from that could also make the dog unreasonably grumpy.
Cleaned_Message: bin job make inconvenient possible bin raid keep away baby gate kitchen door locking good smile ref apa tag ref apa bottom make harder tip bin literal sock eating literally case keeping away waiting mat sit reliably command would train sit every time comes door even summer dry give treat every time walk dog away dogs reactivity pig sort dogs age age see making meaningful progress get abscess sorted yet pain could also make dog unreasonably grumpy

Title: Please give me the strength to adopt ex dps dog.
Message:
We have had [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/simplehuman-Slim-Pedal-Bin-Plastic/dp/B004L9L42O/ref=sr_1_1_sspa?hvlocphy=9045525&psc=1&hvnetw=g&keywords=lockable+bin&spLa=ZW5jcnlwdGVkUXVhbGlmaWVyPUExUTlJQzAxQkpGQkFCJmVuY3J5cHRlZElkPUEwOTMzNzk5MTJFWVBBS1M5U1pWUCZlbmNyeXB0ZWRBZElkPUEwOTkyODc4MkFWMFo1RTJXVUJUVyZ3aWRnZXROYW1lPXNwX2F0ZiZhY3Rpb249Y2xpY2tSZWRpcmVjdCZkb05vdExvZ0NsaWNrPXRydWU=&hvadid=259131688553&qid=1612351754&dchild=1&gclid=CjwKCAiAsOmABhAwEiwAEBR0ZuC0_W-7Qv4JCRIcF38uxDdAHEg9-G37dacyeAk_u1MyxsHo9iGFzhoCIaMQAvD_BwE&hydadcr=5975_1758610&hvdev=c&hvqmt=e&tag=mumsnetforu03-21&hvtargid=kwd-326372006114&adgrpid=54767262138&hvrand=2933694122435299593&sr=8-1-spons this bin]] for five years-ish and my old boy - known to those who love him as â€˜Binnie Pigâ€™ hasnâ€™t managed to get into it yet.

I would use food obsession to your advantage.  Invest in some licki mats and food dispensing toys and puzzles to keep him busy, distract him from nicking your food and also from his pain.  Iâ€™ve recently bought my boy [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/Trixie-34949-Snack-Snake-Tpr/dp/B07CXMKQ8M?tag=mumsnetforu03-21 this snake]] which is tricky to fill, but keeps him busy and focussed for over half an hour, after which he konks out and sleeps for hours.

Have a good read of the [[https://caninearthritis.co.uk/ Canine Arthritis Management website and maybe join their FB group]].  So many things you can do to help him with his joint pain day to day.  Obviously he also needs a vet assessment and I would imagine regular pain meds as well.

The teeth and abscess will most likely be the source of the smell.  Again, as you already know, vet is your first stop, but daily use of something like [[https://www.petdrugsonline.co.uk/virbac-hexarinse-cat-dog-mouthwash Virbac Hexarinse]] will make a massive difference in the meantime, as it destroys the bacteria that makes the smell and also discourages plaque formation.  If he wonâ€™t have it as a mouthswash, you can just soak a microfibre dog toothbrush in the liquid and rub it liberally around his gums and teeth.

Are you lifting his feet to dry them or just wanting him to wait on the mat for a couple of minutes. If heâ€™s objecting to having his feet lifted, itâ€™s probably due to the joint pain, so investing in a really good quality, thick absorbent mat instead might be a better option. Iâ€™d invest in a really decent quality door mat, as big as you can fit in the available space.  Theyâ€™re prices, but Hug Rugs and Turtle Mats are much better at absorbing the dirt/wet quickly.  Alternatively [[https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B082MPP3VV/ref=ox_sc_saved_title_9?smid=A39DCAT3C6531Q&psc=1&tag=mumsnetforu03-21 these]] are cheaper, but still really good. We have them in grey and are waiting to order more when the grey comes back into stock.  Theyâ€™re lovely and soft underfoot as well.  (We have the runners around our kitchen to stop our arthritic dog from slipping.)

Pet insurance is likely to be difficult with a geriatric dog.  I think many of the bigger insurers wonâ€™t start new policies over the age of 8.  Hopefully someone with knowledge of one that does will be along soon.  Bear in mind that even if you do get a policy, teeth are unlikely to be covered and as the abscess is already there, that probably wonâ€™t be either. 

I would still go for third party insurance, even you canâ€™t get health cover though, especially as heâ€™s dog aggressive.  [[https://www.dogstrust.org.uk/get-involved/membership/ You can get it by becoming a member of the Dogs Trust.]]
Cleaned_Message: slim pedal bin plastic ref lockable bin tag bin five old boy known love pig get yet would use food obsession advantage invest food keep busy distract nicking food also pain recently bought boy snack snake tag snake tricky fill busy half hour good read canine arthritis management maybe join group many help joint pain day day obviously also needs vet assessment would imagine regular pain well teeth abscess likely source smell already know vet first stop daily use something like cat dog mouthwash make massive difference bacteria smell also plaque formation soak dog toothbrush liquid rub liberally around teeth lifting dry wanting wait mat couple probably due joint pain really good quality thick absorbent mat instead might better option invest really decent quality door mat big fit available space hug turtle much better absorbing dirt wet quickly alternatively product ref saved title tag still really good grey waiting order grey comes back stock lovely soft underfoot well around kitchen stop arthritic dog slipping pet insurance likely difficult geriatric dog think many bigger start new age hopefully someone knowledge one along soon bear mind even get policy teeth unlikely covered abscess already probably either would still third party insurance even get health cover though especially dog aggressive get involved membership get becoming member dogs trust
